The B2B Marketplace benefits from multiple sourcing channels targeting different types of vendors. The C2B Marketplace creates a highly complementary and enhancing growth engine to that of the B2B Marketplace. The B2B Marketplace provides WeBuyAnyCar with a highly efficient route to dispose of the vehicles it purchases from consumers (typically within 10 days) and, through WeBuyAnyCar, we have the ability to purchase a greater volume and variety of vehicles, which directly helps supply the B2B Marketplace. The Vehicle Buying division provides significant volumes to the UK Vehicle Remarketing division, having accounted for 35% of the vehicles sold through the Marketplace in the UK in the fiscal year 2021. This synergistic model, which leverages WeBuyAnyCar’s market share within the framework of our wider marketplace, creates a platform which we believe would be difficult to replicate. Our ability to dynamically source used vehicles combined with our knowledge and insights on pricing and other demand side dynamics enable us to find an optimum and tailored match for buyers and sellers swiftly, which is key in driving profitability per vehicle. This is further strengthened by the additional services we offer, which increase consumer and vendor experience as well as help us generate greater profitability per vehicle. Our scaled B2B Marketplace and C2B Marketplace provides our pricing model with over six million relevant historic used vehicle transactions. This data enables us to accurately and efficiently price vehicles both upon sourcing and sale. This scale is further supported by our Automotive Services business line and our full suite of pre- and post-auction digital and physical value-added services. This completes the value chain allowing us to cover the full life-cycle, deepen relationships with vendors and customers and maximize profitability per vehicle. Moreover, our Automotive Services business line and our value-added services enable us to record ----- information relating to vehicle condition, maintenance and upkeep, further contributing to the pricing model and further supporting the reliability of pricing decisions. With the launch of B2C Marketplace, outside the restricted group, we have further diversified our buyer and vendor base as cinch acts as another buyer through our auction channel, thereby generating auction fees for our UK Vehicle Remarketing division, as well as additional income for our Automotive Services division. Furthermore, cinch also generates additional supply for the B2B Marketplace via part-exchange vehicles that are remarketed by us and allow us to generate additional auction fees. See “Certain Relationships and Related _Party Transactions—Agreements with cinch.”_ As the scale of each of the business lines has grown and has reached greater volumes and touch points, it has contributed to the further growth of each of the business lines in a virtuous cycle. We believe we are the only operator of digital used vehicle auctions in the UK and continental Europe that offers the scale and the range of services we provide. Our advantages in scale, reputation, relationships, access to proprietary data as well as our established infrastructure and logistics network, which we believe would be difficult for a competitor to replicate.

Subsubsection Title: Resilient Financial Profile and Strong Cash Flow Generation
Subsubsection Text: We believe that our scale, unique business model, reputation and robust financial policies have contributed significantly to our long-term financial resilience, attractive growth and cash flow generation profile. Despite turbulent times such as the global financial crisis of 2008, we were able to consistently maintain and grow volumes and our EBITDA metric (as defined and prepared on the basis of the accounting policies of the relevant parent entity at the time), with such metric having grown at a CAGR of 14.3% from the fiscal year ended December 2004 to fiscal year ended March 2020 and such metric divided by vehicle volumes sold in the respective trading year having grown from £37 per vehicle sold to £137 per vehicle sold over the same period, as shown in the following chart. Our business model’s resilience to market shocks can be further evidenced by our strong organic performance. For example, during the period between 2008 and 2010, we were able to grow volumes by 66,000 vehicles and the applicable EBITDA metric by £24 million in a market backdrop of reduced used car transactions in the UK, which fell from 8.3 million in 2008 to 8.0 million in 2009 before recovering to 8.1 million in 2010. Despite a market backdrop of reduced used vehicle transactions during the fiscal year 2021, our volumes between July 2020 and December 2020 were higher compared to the period between July 2019 and December 2019. In times of a consumer downturn and due to rate of loss in value generally associated with used vehicles, liquidity is of paramount importance to businesses as well as consumers. Our business is also highly cash generative, having generated £145.9 million, £175.1 million and £202.7 million of COVID Adjusted Operating Cash Flow in the 52-week period March 31, 2019, the aggregated 52-week period ended March 29, 2020 and the 52-week period ended March 28, 2021, respectively. This strong cash ----- generation is the result of our ability to grow our IAS 17 COVID Adjusted EBITDA while following a disciplined approach to capital expenditure with the majority of sites being held on long term leases (excluding WeBuyAnyCar retail locations) and most of our transporters and properties being refinanced through sale and leaseback. Adjusted cash conversion (measured by subtracting Underlying Cash CAPEX from IAS 17 COVID Adjusted EBITDA and comparing the result to IAS 17 COVID Adjusted EBITDA) was 84%, 86% and 87% in the 52-week period March 31, 2019, the aggregated 52-week period ended March 29, 2020 and the 52-week period ended March 28, 2021, respectively.

We operate in the used vehicle market across the UK and continental Europe which has grown consistently since 2012, driven by a relatively stable vehicle parc churn and growing vehicle penetration rates. Vehicle penetration rates are expected to continue to grow for most markets. In addition, the used car market is larger and more stable than the new car market. The chart below sets out the volumes of used car sales and new car sales in the UK between 2008 and 2020 as an example of the development of these market. The European vehicle parc has exhibited a CAGR of approximately 1.7% over 2012 to 2019, currently standing at approximately 320 million units as of 2020. As per projections from IHS, the European vehicle parc is expected to exhibit approximately 0.8% CAGR over 2021 to 2026, driven by growth in the penetration of vehicles per population. Assuming churn rates remain the same, this should support growth in the used car market. See “Industry—Overview—UK and Continental European Vehicle Parc.” In 2020, the European used car market was estimated to be worth €410 billion (Source: Roland Berger report _(Apr-21)). Significant fragmentation of buyers and vendors across the UK and continental Europe helps to_ make exchanges a critical channel for both vendors and buyers. For example, the largest used car dealership in the UK is limited to approximately 3% market share, while the largest continental European used car dealership has a market share of less than 1% (Source: IHS and ICDP). In addition, online vehicle buying services are still operating typically at low levels of overall market penetration (e.g., WeBuyAnyCar has ~4% share of total UK used vehicle sales volumes, as of 2020). The COVID 19 pandemic has also accelerated favorable structural trends affecting the markets in which we operate. In particular, consumers have recently begun placing increased emphasis on the importance of owning a car. This has been driven by a variety of different reasons, including people moving away from urban areas due to the ability to work from home and a reluctance to rely entirely on public transport. In addition, the lockdown measures imposed by governments and related closure of car dealerships has made digital channels a principal means of conducting used car auctions. In particular, by the start of 2021 almost all of our auctions were digital as the COVID 19 pandemic and related social distancing regulations accelerated our digitalization plans and encouraged the adoption of digital auctions by our customers. This digital shift allows us to reach a wider range of potential customers and has increased the amount of auctions being held, reducing our daily sales’ costs and allowing us and our customers to receive more vehicle data. Finally, we also benefit from increasing sales of used vehicles as government support and a push towards new technology, including tighter emission controls, encourages vehicle owners to renew their vehicles, driving more exchanges.

Subsubsection Title: Best-in-class Management Team with Successful Track Record of Delivery
Subsubsection Text: We operate with a management team that has significant experience in the automotive sector and has a proven track-record of executing value-accretive initiatives, whether organically or through acquisitions. Our Executive Chairman, Avril Palmer-Baunack, has over 25 years’ executive experience with leading businesses in the automotive, support services, industrial engineering and insurance services sectors, having previously served as Executive Chairman and Deputy CEO of Stobart Group and CEO of Autologic Holdings, where ----- she joined from Universal Salvage and also held the position of CEO. Avril was the founder of Haversham Holdings plc in 2014 and led the acquisition and strategic build of the CA Group where she continues to lead as Executive Chairman. Tim Lampert, our Chief Financial Officer, joined Autologic Holdings in 1997. Tim joined Haversham Holdings plc in January 2015 for the purchase of the BCA Group from CD&R and the subsequent acquisitions prior to the group being de-listed and sold to TDR in November 2019 and has remained as CFO with the formation of the current CA Group. Together, our best-in-class management team brings over 30 years of relationships with major participants across every layer of the UK and continental European automotive sector both at the division and group levels, and more than 100 years of collective experience in the industry across four managing directors as well as legacy knowledge from some of our founders, who are still employed within our Vehicle Buying division. Thanks to its extensive experience, our management team has a proven track record of delivery, with applicable EBITDA growing from £86.0 million in the fiscal year 2014 to £200.8 million in the fiscal year 2020 (as presented under “—Resilient Financial Profile and Strong Cash Flow Generation”) through, among others, the acquisition of multiple infrastructure and logistics businesses. During the same period, B2B Vehicle Volume increased from 999,000 to 1,463,000. Since the fiscal year 2014, C2B Vehicle Volume also increased from 144,000 to 321,000 vehicles and 300,000 vehicles in the fiscal years 2020 and 2021, respectively, with an annualized run rate of 461,000 vehicles (based on trading in March, April and May 2021, which was the most recent three-month period), reflecting the COVID 19 restrictions on the business. The track record of our senior management in delivering cost-effective organic scale growth and successfully integrating acquisitions, is one of our key strengths in a complex and continually evolving industry. In addition, our management is backed by TDR Capital, a leading private equity firm with an integrated investment and operation team of 46 professionals with an average of 15 years of relevant experience and a deep knowledge and track-record in the automotive industry via investments in LeasePlan, CarNext, EuroGarages and International Car Washing Group. The TDR Capital team, together with management, intends to continue our trajectory of consistent volume and profitability growth. We have also created a strong culture of innovation and transparency, winning a number of industry awards for technical innovation, including for BCA Dealer Pro and our website. We believe this has allowed us to maintain a high retention rate of key staff and develop a workforce that is dedicated to delivering high-quality services.

We believe our business platform is strategically positioned for growth in our markets through market share gain from the consumer to consumer (“C2C”) and part-exchange markets (whereby consumers “trade-in” their used vehicle directly to a dealer). The growth of C2B Marketplace supports the growth of our B2B channel as WeBuyAnyCar provides us with used vehicles that would otherwise go to C2C markets or partexchanges and allows us to supply a greater volume and variety of vehicles to our B2B Marketplace. We believe we can drive higher volumes through our auctions through continued market share gain and higher auction penetration in the UK and continental Europe. Our relationships with businesses such as LeasePlan or CarNext, including entering into exclusive service agreements that provide support for our multi-channel strategy, further enhance our sourcing capabilities and drive growth in the vehicle remarketing segment. See “Certain Relationships and Related Party Transactions—Relationship with LeasePlan.”Moreover, by leveraging our “One Europe” strategy via more seamless cross-border transactions, we believe we can create a truly pan-European B2B marketplace for future growth. In addition, COVID 19 restrictions have accelerated consumers’ willingness to adopt digital purchasing as a means to buy a car from current low levels, favoring the growth of online B2C retailers, such as cinch. Our relationship with cinch has increased supply for the B2B Marketplace via part-exchange vehicles that are remarketed by us and allow us to generate additional auction fees. See “Certain Relationships and Related _Party Transactions—Agreements with cinch.” Through cinch, we are also able to develop a B2C channel,_ which enhances our position as an end-to-end service provider. In particular, sales volumes for the B2C channel increased from approximately 4,000 in October 2020 (based on a 7-day rolling annual run-rate) to approximately 38,000 in May 2021.
We believe that, by virtue of the key strengths described below, we are well-positioned to benefit from structurally favorable trends in the used vehicle market.

Subsubsection Title: Enhance our competitive advantage across the value chain as an integrated end-to-end service provider
Subsubsection Text: We plan to drive growth by increasing our B2B Marketplace and C2B Marketplace penetration to increase transaction volumes and scale across our geographies. The increase in scale will serve to provide even deeper access to vehicles, as well as more pricing and vehicle information, and is expected to continue to solidify our position as a leading operator of digital used vehicle auctions across the UK and the continental European countries in which we operate. We also expect to continue leveraging upon and investing in our UK and continental European network and infrastructure. To further increase our scale, we intend to deepen our relationships with other participants in the used vehicle ecosystem, including OEMs, leasing companies, finance companies and dealers, to improve access to used vehicle supply and generate volumes. We plan to provide dealers with additional offerings that suit their business models, to leverage the strength of WeBuyAnyCar’s brand to capture additional supply volumes as consumers become increasingly willing to sell their vehicles through digital channels, and expand our reach to serve customers through partnerships with other B2C platforms. In order to maintain our competitive advantage across the value chain, we will leverage the close relationship between our C2B Marketplace and B2B Marketplace and work on integrating further the insights and data points we are able to collect at different stages, further supplemented by our data sharing agreement with cinch. See “Certain Relationships and Related Party Transactions—Agreements with cinch.” Multiplying our data touchpoints for vehicles entering our ecosystem will enable us to base our decisions on more precise and efficient processes and pricing input. We intend to continue to develop both our digital and physical service offerings to retain and grow the customer base and deliver enhanced profitability. By increasing the penetration of value-added services over time, we expect a compounding effect of fueling Marketplace growth by driving supply and buyer demand, as the comprehensive end-to-end solutions significantly enhance user loyalty. We also intend to further deepen the penetration of services provided by Automotive Services to continue to improve relationships with vendors, both to provide additional vehicle information to benefit our other divisions and to become the preferred choice for vehicle remarketing.

Subsubsection Title: Further deliver on our international expansion strategy
Subsubsection Text: We believe we are well positioned in Europe to become a truly pan-European leader in the used vehicle auction market. Our “One Europe” strategy is focused on leveraging and optimizing our already existing capabilities to provide more seamless cross-border transactions not only in countries where we have physical presence but across the European continent. In continental Europe, which we believe is underpenetrated relative to more developed markets such as the UK, we intend to grow our B2B Marketplace offering as well as our coordinated logistics network and infrastructure to capture further market share and develop scale.

Subsubsection Title: Strengthening our infrastructure and logistics network
Subsubsection Text: As we look to increase our scale and continue to capture more volumes via our platforms, we will continue to invest and strengthen our infrastructure and logistics capabilities in order to serve customers across the value chain, while remaining asset light through the continued use of sale and leaseback transactions. We also intend to develop and modernize our transport vehicles used for vehicle movement. Our aim is to remain a major component of the UK used vehicle market backbone and extend this know-how to our other geographies.

Subsubsection Title: Capitalize on favorable structural industry trends to accelerate our growth
Subsubsection Text: Online penetration for sales of used vehicles has grown significantly, particularly in the UK, in recent years and the associated structural trends further accelerated during the COVID 19 pandemic. During the COVID 19 pandemic, there has been a significant increase in online penetration for sales of used vehicles, as physical venues were shut for lockdown periods and social distancing restrictions and health concerns otherwise caused many consumers to avoid physical venues. Despite the recent acceleration in online ----- penetration growth, we believe the online used car market remains underpenetrated relative to other mass retail markets such as markets for toys and games, consumer electronics and apparel. Further enhancing our digital presence will also allow us to capitalize on additional structural trends that could drive more volumes through our Marketplace and strengthen our positioning and market share on both the supply and demand sides of the ecosystem. In particular, we believe that on the demand side consumers will continue to favor used vehicles for individual transportation to avoid public transportation systems, and that more vehicles will be necessary as consumers move away from city centers to areas where public transportation is inconvenient or unavailable. On the demand side, we look to attract wider audiences via our digital auctions with no limitations linked to historical physical sites. Finally, we will seek to benefit from increasing sales of used vehicles as government support and a push towards new technology, including towards electric and other alternative fuel sources for vehicles, encourages vehicle owners to review their vehicles, driving more exchanges.

Subsubsection Title: Continue to enhance our data capabilities
Subsubsection Text: Our business model is built on leveraging data and technology and we intend to continue to invest in our IT infrastructure and data capabilities to scale up along with volume growth. We use data and technology throughout our business, from providing instant price quotes and targeted marketing campaigns to valuation tools, logistics and inventory management to optimization of refurbishment costs. Through our end-to-end positioning we have access to one of the largest pools of real-time data. As such, we are invested in ensuring that our IT infrastructure remains state-of-the-art to secure better knowledge of our customers and their needs, which in turn is expected to enable us to develop better products and more tailored service as well as more accurate pricing which is expected to help underpin our profitability.

Subsubsection Title: Increase our operational efficiencies and drive strong cash flow and deleveraging
Subsubsection Text: As we look to increase volumes flowing through our Marketplace, we believe we will have an opportunity to improve our profitability per vehicle. Driving continued penetration of automotive services will help maximize the benefit of operational leverage and intragroup efficiencies. Enhancing our data capabilities will allow us to optimize pricing, leading to better unit economics, while we also look to ensure an optimal management of our inventories to ensure a strong cash flow conversion at all times. To support our strong cash generation, we will maintain our disciplined approach to cost management, which proved to be effective in helping us navigate through the COVID 19 pandemic and its associated challenges, maintaining an optimal capital structure and strong deleveraging profile while continuing in investing to grow the business. -----

We seek to create value for stakeholders through organic growth, acquisitions and partnerships in the automotive sector in the UK and continental Europe. We continue to work with major market participants to ----- develop and adapt integrated solutions to solve and meet the needs of the participants across the automotive sector, maximizing value for all stakeholders. To achieve this goal, we are focused on enhancing our competitive advantage as an integrated end-to-end service provider, further expanding internationally, strengthening our infrastructure and logistics network, capitalizing on favorable industry trends, continuing to enhance our data capabilities and improving our operational efficiencies, cash flow and leverage.

Vehicle Remarketing is comprised of the UK Vehicle Remarketing division and the International Vehicle Remarketing division. Together, these divisions operate close to accessible transport routes and facilitate the exchange of used vehicles, having sold 1.2 million, 1.5 million and 1.4 million vehicles in the fiscal years 2021, 2020 and 2019, respectively (with fiscal year 2021 being the period most adversely affected by the COVID 19 pandemic). In the 53-week period ended May 30, 2021, Vehicle Remarketing sold 1.4 million vehicles. Vehicle Remarketing generated IAS 17 Adjusted EBITDA of £119.7 million in the 52-week period ended March 28, 2021. Vehicle Remarketing operates primarily on an agency basis (in such role, taking no title or inventory risk to the vehicles it transacts), except for our outsourced remarketing contracts which allow us to selectively secure batches of supply. Vehicle Remarketing generates its revenue through a mix of vehicle transaction fees and value-added service fees. During the fiscal year 2020, approximately 37% of UK auctions were transacted online, however, by the start of the fiscal year 2021 all our UK auctions were digital as the COVID 19 pandemic and related social distancing regulations accelerated our digitalization plans and encouraged the acceptance of digital auctions by our customers. While we retain the option to conduct one-off physical auctions for certain customers, we will continue to focus on digital auctions. As a result, many of our physical sites are now being used for the provision of storage and refurbishment services to our customers in support of our digital auctions. In addition, the digital shift has increased auction capacity, reduced our daily sales’ costs and provides us with more data. -----

Auctions are our core business activity. We auction vehicles of all ages and types, principally cars and light commercial vehicles (“LCVs”), selling 1.4 million vehicles in the 53-week period ended May 30, 2021, a period adversely impacted by the COVID 19 pandemic, compared to 1.5 million in the fiscal year 2020. As part of our auctions, transaction fees are charged per vehicle sold through the Marketplace and are received from both buyers and vendors, with the vast majority generated from buyers. Vehicle Remarketing does not take title to the majority of vehicles (with title instead passing from the vendor directly to the buyer). Online auctions are conducted as real time online auction sales with the auctioneer providing descriptions to the buyers and coordinating the auction. We also offer “eBay-style” longer-term online auctions in which users can either purchase vehicles from our online catalogue at a pre-determined asking price (a “Buy Now” service) or bid on vehicles during auctions that run for pre-set periods of time (a “Bid Now”service). Auctions are conducted daily and both vendors and buyers benefit from their 24/7 access to online bidding and the ability to search and compare vehicles from multiple locations and in multiple languages. Auctions can be accessed using BCA Live Online or the BCA Buyer mobile application. _BCA Live Online_ BCA Live Online broadcasts live video and audio to remote bidders via the Internet using technology developed in-house, allowing online bidders to compete in real time. Buyers can pre-plan their auction activity using our catalogue previews and the vehicle tracking functionality on our BCA Buyer mobile application, allowing buyers to track in real-time when a vehicle will be up for live auction. During a sale, a live messaging service allows buyers to engage directly with the auctioneers and there is capability to follow up to four auction sales simultaneously. If buyers are unable to attend a given auction, they are also offered the option to place concealed proxy bids, allowing them to place a set bid for a particular vehicle in advance, prior to the end of the relevant auction. BCA Live Online also allows potential buyers to view, bid on and ultimately purchase vehicles at auctions across Europe from one location, eliminating the need to travel to physical auction sites. _BCA Buyer Mobile Application_ Our BCA Buyer mobile application integrates with BCA Live Online to allow industry buyers to manage their selections and bidding across platforms. Simple vehicle tracking takes the guesswork out of auction timings, with prompted notifications automatically sent to buyers whose targeted vehicle is ten lots away. The use of our BCA Buyer mobile application has increased over the past two years and it now offers the same functionalities as BCA Live Online, including full bidding, buying, delivery, collection and payment journeys.

The UK Vehicle Remarketing division’s vendors are divided into five main groups: (i) dealers, comprising 23% of our volume for the fiscal year 2021, (ii) vehicle buying, comprising 35% of our volume for the fiscal year 2021, (iii) OEMs, comprising 7% of our volume for the fiscal year 2021, (iv) corporates, which include leasing companies and OEM finance companies, comprising 21% of our volume for the fiscal year 2021 and (v) trade and others, comprising 15% of our volume for the fiscal year 2021. The majority of used vehicles in the wholesale market in key European geographies is generated by OEMs and corporates, although there are some country-specific differences. The majority of our sales arrangements with our vendors are framework agreements, renewed annually and provide only pricing and service levels. The framework agreements do not guarantee the provision of a minimum number of vehicles to us and typically do not commit the vendor to exclusively supply vehicles to us. Nevertheless, we have a track record of vendor retention. As of March 28, 2021, we held long-term client relationships with an impressive track record of retention of our customers; by vehicles sold, 13 of our top 18 vendors (excluding WeBuyAnyCar) have each worked with us for five or more years and ten of them have worked with us for over ten years. In particular, for the fiscal year 2021, of the top 18 vendor relationships (excluding WeBuyAnyCar) 77% of volume was contributed by vendors with a relationship over ten years. _Dealers_ Dealer vendors are comprised of a large number of franchised and non-franchised dealers. Dealers typically sell vehicles obtained through part-exchanges from consumers, as well as over-age stock that is no longer suitable for their retail showrooms. As a result, dealers sell vehicles through us that typically are more than five years old. ----- _WeBuyAnyCar_ WeBuyAnyCar sells all of its vehicles through the Marketplace. See “—Vehicle Buying.” The age of vehicles we sell varies widely. _OEMs_ OEMs typically use the Marketplace to dispose of demo fleets, buy-backs from rental companies and management vehicles. As a result, the vehicles sold by OEMs through us tend to be among the youngest sold through the Marketplace and usually are less than two years old. _Corporates_ Corporate vendors, including contract hire, leasing and finance companies, typically dispose of end-of-lease or repossessed vehicles through the Marketplace. Leasing company vendors in particular typically seek to liquidate vehicles that they no longer seek to lease (and thus view as liabilities) as quickly as possible through the Marketplace. The supply of vehicles from corporate vendors is affected by the number of vehicles that have reached the end of the life of their relevant underlying contracts (which are typically three to five years in duration), and reflects the number of vehicles taken onto contract by such corporate vendors’ customers in preceding years. _Trade and others_ Trade and others are comprised of other companies that do not fall into the other main categories, such as public sector suppliers, owned fleet and various other independent sellers of vehicles.

Our buyer base is highly fragmented, comprising more than 25,000 active trade buyers (i.e., buyers who use remarketing channels to source used vehicle inventory and intend to resell the purchased vehicle) as of March 28, 2021. Our trade buyers are divided into two main groups: (i) franchised dealers, who use the Marketplace and vehicles obtained from part-exchanges as a source to supplement inventory, and (ii) independent dealers and wholesale traders. Our independent dealer buyers will make use of remarketing companies for a constant supply of vehicles. Wholesale traders are dispersed through a large number of individual and small companies which source vehicles from auctions and act as middlemen on behalf of other buyers.

In addition to our core auction business, Vehicle Remarketing provides a wide spectrum of supplemental, value-added digital and physical pre- and post-auction services to both vendors and buyers, ranging from upstream services to pre-auction preparation and marketing products to post-auction logistics services. These services enable vendors to select from a range of services to enhance the marketability of vehicles, thereby facilitating their disposal process, while also improving the information available to buyers. Value-added services have the additional benefit of enhancing customer retention rates within Vehicle Remarketing, as our customers are able to obtain the wide range of services from a single source, as opposed to having to turn to different providers for each service which results in additional costs and lead times to disposal. Value-added service fees are charged depending on the particular type of service sold by Vehicle Remarketing. Some of the value-added services within Vehicle Remarketing are also offered on a standalone basis as part of our Automotive Services division, thereby affording us flexibility as to whether these services should be offered as part of our remarketing offering or separately and allowing us to offer more bespoke solutions to our customers based on their specific needs. The chart below shows our services across the post-factory automotive market value chain. ----- _Upstream Services_ In order to help dealers manage their part-exchanges, we have developed BCA Dealer Pro, an online application that organizes and improves various stages of the part-exchange process. BCA Dealer Pro also assists dealers in disposing of their vehicles through the Marketplace quickly and seamlessly, as the data captured by BCA Dealer Pro is easily integrated into our auction platforms. The key services addressed by BCA Dealer Pro are: - data capture facilitating valuation—identifying the vehicle, conducting an appraisal, capturing retail-quality images and obtaining an accurate valuation; - stock management—managing dealer stock and inter-dealer allocations, providing data analysis tools and retail inventory data feeds and assisting in stock liquidation and stock replacement; - remarketing services—managing logistics, sales preparation and demand data; - buyer services—providing transparent pricing, logistics and vehicle preparation; and - merchandising—offering digital content upload, key retailing data, imaging and video. In continental Europe, we have developed MarketPrice, a service that provides dealers with a valuation for their part-exchange vehicles. MarketPrice is available at no charge to dealers, in exchange for a commitment to sell part-exchange vehicles through the Marketplace. While BCA Dealer Pro and MarketPrice generate relatively low revenue and are offered prior to any decision to sell a vehicle through the Marketplace, we believe these online tools help to develop our relationship with vendors and incentivize them to provide vehicles to the Marketplace for sale. We believe that vendors using these online applications are more likely to subsequently provide a greater proportion of their vehicles to the Marketplace for sale, thus increasing the number of vehicles sold through the Marketplace. _Pre-auction Services_ Once a vendor has decided to sell a vehicle through the Marketplace, we provide vendors with a fully integrated vehicle pre-auction service. We offer vehicle collection and transportation services, primarily in the UK, to move vendors’ vehicles to the Marketplace (or, if requested, to third-party de-fleeting locations). We also provide vendors with storage services prior to the auction. Moreover, we organize both single and multiple vehicle collections, varying pricing depending on the distance and number of vehicles moved. We utilize a combination of our own fleet of transporters and contracted plate drivers, as well as third-party companies (that provide their own transporters and plate drivers). When a vehicle arrives at our facilities, we undertake a standardized appraisal of the vehicle’s condition to help the vendor set an appropriate reserve price and ensure an accurate and consistent vehicle description is provided to auction participants. Depending on a vehicle’s condition, Vehicle Remarketing offers a range of services to vendors designed to improve a vehicle’s condition and maximize its resale value, as many buyers seek ready-to-retail vehicles. For more extensive repair needs, Vehicle Remarketing offers Smart Repair, our repair service that includes cosmetic improvements, body work, dent repair, light mechanical repair, glass repair and tire replacement. Following any valet or repair services performed on a vehicle, we are able to capture high-quality photographs and video for display on BCA Auction View, the online search tool used by buyers across the Marketplace. ----- BCA Auction View provides our buyers with free access to the search capability, including all vehicles scheduled for sale through the Marketplace. We have organized our search function to allow potential buyers to search and view vehicles by make, age, grade, fuel, color, transmission and several other criteria. In addition, BCA Auction View provides users with comprehensive vehicle data, including images, videos and appraisal reports. Our video streaming and software development subsidiary, AutosOnShow, further enhances our offering by providing imaging services to dealers following the sale of a vehicle, thereby allowing such dealers to market the vehicle with their own branding prior to taking physical delivery of the vehicle. Through BCA Assured, we provide buyers with additional comfort on the condition of vehicles that would typically be sold “as seen” at our auctions. BCA Assured is a 40+point mechanical appraisal carried out by certified technicians on all vehicles within certain mileage and ownership conditions. During the appraisal, our technicians asses each vehicle in accordance with a comprehensive auction grid that takes into account a number of cosmetic and technical requirements and produce an imaging suite, following which our dedicated algorithm grades each vehicle for valuation purposes. The BCA Assured check is offered as an additional service that accompanies a bid and is designed to give potential buyers confidence to buy despite an inability to road test vehicles. The BCA Assured inspection covers a wide range of checks from condition of tires, to engine performance and brake checks. Buyers of BCA Assured-covered vehicles have the earlier of 48 hours or 500 miles to contact us if a vehicle’s condition has been misreported, with our dispute resolution team working with buyers to resolve any claims. _Post-auction Services_ Following a vehicle’s sale, we provide buyers with both storage and delivery services to the vehicle’s final destination. Through BCA Partner Finance, we offer stock funding (trade finance) to certain registered dealers in the UK, which incrementally enhances the liquidity of the buyer base, thereby stimulating further demand within the Marketplace. For eligible customers, our buyer finance services can be used to fully fund vehicle purchases of all grades, including auction costs and ancillary fees. Typically, we provide finance support to established buyers that are pre-approved and have a specified credit limit. As a result, and due to our close relationship with these buyers and the use of our proprietary credit scoring process, we are well-positioned to assess the credit risk of our borrowers and as such default rates and bad debt for BCA Partner Finance is low. Financing is provided for an initial period of 60 days, with a possible 60-day extension, and is secured by the financed vehicle (in the form of a security marker on such vehicle) as well as personal guarantees. If a dealer defaults on its interest or principal payment, we have the right to recover the financed vehicle. However, typically, we receive repayment once a vehicle is re-sold by the buyer. Part-funding for BCA Partner Finance is provided by the Receivables Facility, as defined in and described under “Description of Other Financial Arrangements—Receivables Facility Agreement.”

Our Vehicle Buying division operates primarily in the UK as part of the C2B Marketplace, through WeBuyAnyCar, but also operates in continental Europe, where it focuses on purchasing batches of vehicles from corporates as part of the B2B Marketplace. In the 52-week period ended March 28, 2021, the Vehicle Buying division generated IAS 17 Adjusted EBITDA of £44.0 million.

In the UK, we conduct our Vehicle Buying operations through our trusted digital brand, WeBuyAnyCar. The service has over 100,000 Trust Pilot reviews, and an overall “Excellent” rating, which is testament to the strength and reputation of the WeBuyAnyCar brand. WeBuyAnyCar purchases and thereby provides us with used vehicles owned by private consumers that would otherwise be destined for the consumer-to-consumer or part-exchange markets. Through our online pricing quotation system and our 357 physical locations across the UK as of March 28, 2021, we purchase any used vehicle owned by a private consumer, irrespective of vehicle make, model, age or condition after having done our customary vehicle inspections. In the fiscal year 2021, a period adversely impacted by the COVID 19 pandemic, WeBuyAnyCar purchased and sold 300,000 vehicles from consumers in the UK. Run-rate total number of vehicles purchased and sold through WeBuyAnyCar are estimated to be approximately 461,000 vehicles (based on trading in March, April and May 2021, which was the most recent three-month period). ----- Our Vehicle Buying division targets sellers who are seeking a fast, safe and convenient alternative to sell their used vehicles at a competitive price. We also provide sellers with a quick source of liquidity. _WeBuyAnyCar Sale Process_ WeBuyAnyCar’s website (www.webuyanycar.com) is the first point of interaction for most of the Vehicle Buying division’s sellers. We have built and continue to maintain the WeBuyAnyCar brand through television, radio and Internet advertising campaigns. WeBuyAnyCar’s website attracted approximately 22.7 million unique visitors in the fiscal year 2021. The website’s key feature is its ability to use a proprietary pricing engine that analyzes various vehicle parameters to provide an initial valuation of a vehicle virtually instantly. As a result, we believe that WeBuyAnyCar is able to provide competitive valuations to its sellers. In the fiscal year 2021, WeBuyAnyCar provided a total of 15.6 million valuations. Having obtained an initial valuation of their vehicle online, potential sellers are invited to schedule an appointment at one of WeBuyAnyCar’s 357 retail branches located across the UK, with appointments available as early as the same day. Potential sellers may also bring their vehicles direct to a WeBuyAnyCar branch, without first accessing its website, to obtain a quote on their vehicle. WeBuyAnyCar’s branches are open for both online appointments and walk-in valuations up to seven days a week, and on average a WeBuyAnyCar customer lives within a 14-minute drive of a WeBuyAnyCar branch. At the in-branch appointment, a WeBuyAnyCar representative inspects the vehicle to confirm that the online description and specifications provided by the potential seller (if applicable) were accurate and checks for other mechanical and cosmetic damage to the vehicle. The WeBuyAnyCar representative then issues a final offer price to the potential seller to buy the vehicle. The entire in-person sale process is typically completed within 30 minutes. After a seller accepts WeBuyAnyCar’s offer price, WeBuyAnyCar cross-checks the vehicle against vehicle databases and confirms the seller’s ownership. WeBuyAnyCar then arranges for the transfer of ownership and payment of the agreed purchase price for the vehicle is made by bank transfer. For an additional fee, WeBuyAnyCar will make an expedited payment transfer of the net purchase payment to the seller. WeBuyAnyCar deducts a transaction fee from the final sale price paid to the sellers of the vehicles it purchases. All of the vehicles purchased by WeBuyAnyCar are sold through the UK Vehicle Remarketing division. WeBuyAnyCar is the UK Vehicle Remarketing division’s largest vendor, providing 35% of the vehicles sold through us in the fiscal year 2021. In the fiscal year 2020, which is representative of our ordinary course business operations in a steady state, vehicles in the UK were onwards sold within approximately 10 days through the UK Vehicle Remarketing division, while in the fiscal year 2021, as a result of the COVID 19 pandemic, onwards sales took place at an average of approximately 20 days.

In continental Europe, our Vehicle Buying division focuses on purchasing batches of vehicles from corporates, providing a controlled supply, adding mix and diversity to auction inventory in the International Vehicle Remarketing division.

We operate through three main business lines: (i) the B2B Marketplace business line, which is comprised of our UK Vehicle Remarketing division, our International Vehicle Remarketing division and our Vehicle Buying division’s operations in continental Europe, (ii) the C2B Marketplace business line, which is WeBuyAnyCar, our Vehicle Buying division’s operations in the UK, and (iii) the Automotive Services business line. These business lines are interlinked, with the Vehicle Remarketing divisions re-selling all of the vehicles acquired by the Vehicle Buying division and the Automotive Services division providing vehicle movement, logistics, storage, pre-delivery inspections, fleet management, de-fleeting services and refurbishment services. Our divisions are also interlinked through end-to-end data flows, in order to optimize the platform. At each vehicle touch point throughout the value chain, data on the vehicle is collected which informs decisions on value, condition and refurbishment requirements. We have a dedicated team of data scientists and have been able to utilize their data pool to develop highly accurate pricing capabilities based on multiple vehicle parameters, including age, mileage, color and condition, which enables us to maximize margins in real time. Today, more than 6 million historic used vehicle transactions feed our pricing model, which empowers the broader platform. We have physical sites spanning the UK and across nine continental European countries, including in Germany, France, the Netherlands, Denmark, Spain, Sweden, Portugal, Italy and Norway, but serve customers across an even wider region. In the fiscal year 2020, we exported more than 70,000 vehicles from our International Vehicle Remarketing division, to over 40 different countries. The diagram below sets out the geographic presence of our physical remarketing operations as of March 28, 2021: Constellation Sites

In the 52-week period ended March 28, 2021, the Automotive Services division generated IAS 17 Adjusted EBITDA of £12.5 million. With a national network of sites, the Automotive Services division brings together our automotive vehicle movement, logistics, storage, pre-delivery inspections, fleet management, de-fleeting and refurbishment services, providing a comprehensive suite of services in an integrated manner. The division continues to increase the penetration of internal moves and refurbishment completed for the UK Vehicle Remarketing division and WeBuyAnyCar, driving increased internal efficiency and reducing costs. Under our Automotive Services division, we aim to act as a one-stop shop for the passage of vehicles throughout their life and capture auction volumes earlier in the life-cycle by working directly with specific vendors, such as fleet providers and OEMs. By locking in a relationship with vendors at the start of the car’s life cycle, we not only expand our opportunity for revenue streams along the value chain but also place ourselves to be a potential route of remarketing when the vehicle comes off lease or rolls out of the fleet. As part of the Automotive Services division, we handle bulk vehicle movements to and from ports, manufacturing centers, pre-delivery inspection facilities, storage and refurbishment centers, auction sites and dealerships, on behalf of our third party customers, the UK Vehicle Remarketing division, BCA Partner ----- Finance customers and WeBuyAnyCar. Collected vehicles are driven on transport vehicles to secure central hub locations and the movement between hubs is performed by the transporter fleet. This hub and spoke network reduces driver hours, the risks to vehicles, general wear and tear and allows us to maximize the use of capacity in under-utilized or empty return legs. In addition, movement between hubs can occur overnight when the road network is less congested and external customers’ sites are not operational. Continued investment has resulted in a modern and efficient fleet of transporters, improving operational comfort for our employees and reliability for our customers. As of March 28, 2021, we operated a leading UK transporter fleet, comprising 901 trucks capable of providing bulk vehicle movements, thereby connecting the physical marketplace and increasing the integration between our divisions. In the fiscal year 2021, our in-house transporter fleet and sub-contractors organized by us moved 1.8 million vehicles in bulk and accounted for 94% of transport arranged by the UK Vehicle Remarketing division. We also offer single vehicle movements, customer handover specialists and vehicle inspection and collection services as well as trade plate movements for LCVs. In the fiscal year 2021, our single vehicle movements amounted to a further 563,000 vehicles moved. Furthermore, as part of our Automotive Services offering, we provide new vehicle support to customers from factory gate or port of entry to fleet or retail availability. Such services include reception, customs management and handling at port or factory gate, pre-delivery inspection and new vehicle preparation, accessory fitment and customization, warranty and servicing as well as storage and compound management. We also offer specialist services in fleet management, de-fleet and refurbishment. Our fleet management expertise gives us the capabilities to offer customers full service fleet management solutions, providing consistently high levels of customer service and peace of mind for fleet customers, including (i) booking, management and administration, (ii) preparation, maintenance and storage, (iii) document management and reporting and (iv) handover, inspection and collection services. Our de-fleet and refurbishment services include (i) inspection and estimation services, (ii) refurbishment, (iii) service and warranty, (iv) studio quality imaging, (v) valet and secure storage and (vi) wheel refurbishment. These services are delivered to consistent standards, at scale, and cost-effectively. In the fiscal year 2021, we utilized the capability and expertise developed in preparing and refurbishing fleet vehicles to establish and support the newly-developed “Retail Ready”industry vehicle standard. “Retail Ready”vehicles are cosmetically and mechanically prepared to be immediately placed for sale to consumers and are therefore particularly attractive to online car dealers. Some of our services within the Automotive Services division are also cross-sold to our UK Vehicle Remarketing division, thereby affording us flexibility as to whether these services should be directly offered to the customer or cross-sold to another division and allowing us to offer more bespoke solutions to our customers based on their specific needs.

We depend on our IT function to support our operating divisions and our back-office functions. We maintain a large number of IT staff across the UK and continental Europe, which are organized into the following areas: Technology Operations, Product, Information Security & Business Continuity, Enterprise Applications, Transport & Logistics, Architecture, CTO and Portfolio Management. These teams cover all operating divisions, both in the UK and continental Europe. We also rely on a small number of strategic partners to supply, deliver and support some of our key technologies, supplementing our internal teams capabilities and providing us with capacity and flexibility to adapt with business demand. Our technology is split between hosted third-party data centers and public cloud infrastructure. Our systems and products consist of a mixture of commercial off-the-shelf and bespoke developed platforms, and are categorized as follows: - Digital auctions: our digital auctions are focused on the development of our end-to-end auction e-commerce journey. Our core Auction Information System (the “AIS”) is used to manage vehicles through the physical processes at our physical remarketing locations, manage physical stock, compound management, sale channel allocation, bid management and, within the UK, for invoicing to customers. The AIS integrates with our other information technology systems and products. The main buyer interfaces are the BCA Auction View website and the BCA Buyer mobile application in the UK and the pan-European e-commerce Platform (PEEP) in continental Europe. These allow buyers to search our stock, manage their interest, purchases and payments online and link seamlessly with our online auction system, BCA Live Online, which provides real-time online buying to all our auctions. These systems support buyers in their local language, currency and delivery requirements and can be provided as White Label, which are vendor-branded auction platforms. ----- - Inspections, appraisal and valuations: we are focused on the development and maintenance of our range of tools to capture vehicle condition for inspection, appraisal and valuation purposes at different parts of the group such as WeBuyAnyCar, dealer and online part-exchanges, lease collections, fleet returns and remarketing locations. We are working to bring these tools into a common system that can provide all the data required for the entire vehicle journey at the first touch point. - Vehicle lifecycle management: through BCA Dealer Pro, we provide a toolset that allows us and our large corporate vendors to manage vehicles in the transition between the de-fleet and remarketing stages of their lifecycle, streamlining processes and providing data-driven insights that enable better decision-making for the customer and ensures easy integration into our suite of products and services. - Transport and logistics: the specialist transport systems that underpin our cross-divisional logistics capability are key to maximizing our efficiency in order to meet the needs of our customers and of our divisions. Our transport and logistics products support the planning, optimization and orchestration of both singlevehicle and multi-vehicle movements, both intra-divisionally and to or from external customers. - WeBuyAnyCar: we have developed a suite of bespoke products that allow for the smooth and efficient operation of the WeBuyAnyCar business from the point at which a customer visits our website to the moment the purchase is completed and monies are transferred. These products provide the website and valuation and quoting system, as well as the various tools in use across the retail estate with which the WeBuyAnyCar staff assesses, values and purchases vehicles from the general public. - BCA Partner Finance: we use a commercial, off-the-shelf software that is integrated within our AIS and allows us to provide finance for qualifying customers and the purchases they make.

The main purpose of the marketing team is to promote the Marketplace and its related services to both vendors and buyers in collaboration with the sales and operational teams. Customer service is part of the function. In addition, our sales teams seek to maintain and develop relationships with existing vendors. Our Vehicle Remarketing divisions trade under the BCA brand name, which is well known in the UK, having traded for more than 70 years. Our efforts at maintaining and promoting our brand are focused on growing BCA brand awareness in continental Europe and raising awareness of the breadth of our products and services portfolio. Vehicle Remarketing targets buyers to purchase vehicles across its digital platforms and holds an extensive database of historic customer-buying behavior and preferences. Buyers are targeted based on their existing and potential purchasing opportunity across the facets of vehicle make, model, age, mileage, type, price, location, sales and channel characteristics. Vehicle Remarketing’s marketing campaigns integrate print and digital media, direct mail and e-mail marketing and telemarketing, as appropriate. New developments across Vehicle Remarketing’s digital channels increase the opportunity to sell vehicles online by providing greater confidence to potential online buyers. We continually develop new products and services for use by both vendors and buyers. Digital initiatives include improved vehicle imagery and data for search functions and improved user experience for online and mobile applications. Value-added services such as BCA Dealer Pro and BCA Partner Finance have also expanded Vehicle Remarketing’s product marketing capability. Vehicle Remarketing has an extensive database of vendor, buyer and vehicle transactional data. This data provides insight on auction pricing trends and assesses other trends within the Marketplace, providing greater insight on product value-add and buyer behavior, thereby creating opportunities to attract new customers and optimize the performance of the Marketplace.

The Vehicle Buying division’s marketing strategy focuses on driving volume growth and strengthening brand reputation through a variety of tools, such as search engine marketing (“SEM”), conversion rate optimization, relationship marketing and commercial analytics. Maintaining and increasing WeBuyAnyCar’s brand strength is a key marketing goal of the Vehicle Buying division. The Vehicle Buying division conducts advertising campaigns on TV, radio and the internet to increase web traffic by vehicle owners looking to dispose of their vehicles. It also has a strong relationship with Google and ----- has benefited from priority access to performance enhancing SEM-beta programs. The Vehicle Buying division regularly analyses its media spend across TV, radio and the Internet to increase the efficiency of these marketing activities.

Our intellectual property rights include proprietary technology and software relating to digital auction systems as well as trademarks, trade secrets, copyrights and other intellectual property. Our increased reliance in recent years on proprietary Internet-based programs and technology have increased the relative importance of intellectual property assets to our business. Our business and IT systems and other key proprietary intellectual property generally are not protected by patents or registered design rights. As a result, we are reliant on trademarks, copyright, database rights, registered domain names and the law protecting confidential information to protect our brands, technologies and databases.

The majority of our operating properties in the UK (excluding WeBuyAnyCar retail locations) are subject to long-term leases, which are recognized under IFRS 16 in our results of operations. The retail locations operated by WeBuyAnyCar are small in size and are typically subject to a contractual term of less than five years in duration. We also hold limited freehold properties in the UK. In continental Europe, our real estate holdings comprise a mix of freehold and leasehold properties. In new markets, we tend to seek shorterterm leases to afford ourselves with greater operational flexibility.

We are committed to providing a safe working environment wherever we operate, employing a proactive network of health and safety professionals who deliver training and share knowledge and experience with the aim of fostering best practice and ensuring consistently high standards of safety across our group. Health and safety managers and committees are responsible for monitoring and reporting adherence to our health and safety protocols to their divisional leaders. The COVID 19 pandemic has had, and will continue to have, a significant impact on our business with regards to the health and safety of our employees, customers and suppliers. We are committed to ensuring that our working environments are safe and the measures taken in response to the COVID 19 pandemic meet the requirements in each of the jurisdictions in which we operate. Our operations are subject to various health, safety and environmental laws and regulations in the jurisdictions in which we operate, including those governing the emission and discharge of pollutants into the air or water, the generation, treatment, storage and release of hazardous materials and wastes and the investigation and remediation of contamination. Large numbers of vehicles are stored and prepared for sale at our facilities and during that time releases of fuel, motor oil and other materials may occur. Furthermore, at our physical locations, our employees come into close contact with moving vehicles.

With respect to environmental, social and governance matters, we have worked with Transport for London to run ultra-low emission compliant auctions to highlight the launch of the low emission area in London. We have seen an increase in the numbers of vehicles that are electric or hybrid coming into auctions, and in 2021 we switched the UK Vehicle Remarketing division to an electricity supplier which provides 100% renewable electricity generated from wind, hydro and solar power (commencing October 1, 2021). Furthermore, our transporter fleet includes trucks equipped with automatic gear changing systems that assist the driver by selecting the most appropriate and efficient gear. We have committed to charitable causes through fundraising activities and donations including a virtual oneday charity cycle and providing financial support to Ben, a non-profit organization supporting automotive industry employees. We have significantly increased our number of mental health first aiders, partnering with Mental Health England. We also have a strong focus on improving the capability of our people through providing career development opportunities and ongoing training, offering our employees counselling and well-being support through our new employee assistance programme and online well-being center. We have in place a robust framework of governance and compliance underpinned by core values, abiding by enhanced annual reporting disclosure obligations placed upon portfolio companies and private equity in conformity with “The Walker Guidelines.” The six “Wates Principles” are key areas of focus for us, including: ----- purpose and leadership, board composition, directors’ responsibilities, opportunity and risk, remuneration, and stakeholder relationships and engagement. In addition, we encourage diversity and are committed to providing equal opportunities within the workplace.

The principal risks covered by our insurance policies relate to property damage, business interruption, employers and public liability and certain other claims consistent with customary practice in the industry in which we operate. We purchase our insurance through well-known providers. We have not had any material insurance claims, nor have we suffered any material loss following any uninsured claim, in the fiscal years 2021, 2020 and 2019.

For the year ended March 28, 2021, we had an average of 7,365 employees, of which 6,440 were based in the UK. We also use a number of self-employed drivers for the provision of transport services within our Automotive Services division. We are subject to various laws that regulate wages (including minimum wage laws), hours, benefits and other terms and conditions relating to employment in the various countries in which we operate, and we provide benefits to employees as required by applicable law. We are committed to supporting our staff throughout their careers and provide training to a number of our employees through our graduate development program and apprenticeship opportunities. We strive to make working for our group rewarding in every sense. We always target competence and potential in our recruiting process, and then support our employees with the training and development necessary to reach their full potential. We also use bonus schemes as a part of employee compensation to incentivize efficiency, with performance-based bonuses representing significant components of the compensation for many managementlevel employees. We participate in several defined contribution pension schemes in the UK and in certain continental European countries as well as two defined benefit pension plans in the UK. The two defined benefit pension plans in the UK provide benefits based on final pensionable salary, are registered with HMRC and comply with the regulatory framework published by the UK pensions regulator. Benefits are paid to the members from a separate fund administered by independent trustees. Our total contribution to these defined contribution schemes in the 52-week period ended March 28, 2021 was £6.4 million. As of March 28, 2021, the two defined benefit pension plans in the UK had a deficit of £12.4 million (2020: £15.1 million). See “Risk Factors—Risks Relating to Our Business—We have several _defined contribution pension schemes in certain continental European countries as well as two defined benefit pension plans in the UK, some of which are in deficit.”_

We have been and, from time to time, may continue to become party to claims, proceedings and lawsuits incidental to the ordinary course of our business. We are not currently involved in any other legal or arbitration proceedings that are expected to have a material adverse effect on our financial position and, to our knowledge, no such legal or arbitration proceedings are currently threatened. -----

The Issuer was incorporated as a public limited company under the laws of England and Wales on June 29, 2021 in contemplation of the Refinancing Transactions. The Issuer is a wholly owned subsidiary of the Parent. The following table lists the members of the board of directors of the Issuer, as well as their respective ages:

Subsection Title: Tim Lampert started his career in manufacturing companies before joining a division of Bombardier Inc. in
Subsubsection Text: finance roles in the UK and the Middle East. Tim joined Autologic Holdings in 1997 and held various roles including Finance Director, Logistics Director, Projects Director and Managing Director and was involved in the sale of the business. He joined Haversham Holdings plc in January 2015 for the purchase of the BCA Group from CD&R and the subsequent acquisitions prior to the group being de-listed and sold to TDR in November 2019 and has remained as CFO with the formation of the current CA Group. Tim is a fellow of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants.

Subsection Title: Thibaut Large joined TDR Capital in November 2009. Prior to joining TDR Capital, he spent five years at
Subsubsection Text: Apax Partners, where he focused on leveraged buyouts in the media sector. Thibaut received an MBA degree from Harvard Business School, as a Baker Scholar, and an MEng degree in Aeronautical Engineering, with first class honors, from Imperial College.

Subsection Title: Mark Stephens joined TDR Capital in September 2012. Prior to joining TDR Capital, he worked at Morgan
Subsubsection Text: Stanley in London as an Associate in its Private Equity Fund team, and previously as an Analyst in its UK Investment Banking team. Mark received a degree in Business and Legal Studies, with first class honors, from University College Dublin.

The Parent was incorporated as a private limited company under the laws of England and Wales on June 10, 2019 in contemplation of the CA Acquisition. The board of the Parent’s main responsibility is to approve our financial statements and other ancillary matters. The following table lists the members of the board of directors of the Parent, as well as their respective ages:

Constellation Automotive was incorporated as a private limited company incorporated under the laws of England and Wales on June 10, 2019 in contemplation of the CA Acquisition. Constellation Automotive is the immediate subsidiary of the Parent. The board of directors of Constellation Automotive is our main board. The following table lists the members of the board of directors of Constellation Automotive, as well as their respective ages:

Subsection Title: Avril Palmer-Baunack has over has over 25 years’ executive experience with leading businesses in the
Subsubsection Text: automotive, support services, industrial engineering and insurance services sectors. Her automotive operational experience spans vehicle salvage, car hire, auctions, transportation, distribution, logistics, vehicle processing and infrastructure. Avril was previously Executive Chairman of Stobart Group, one of the largest British multimodal logistics companies with interests in transport, distribution and infrastructure. Prior to this Avril was CEO of Autologic Holdings, where she joined from Universal Salvage plc where she held the position of CEO from March 2005 until the sale of the company to Copart Inc in June 2007. Avril was the founder of Haversham Holdings plc in 2014 and led the acquisition and strategic build of the CA Group where she continues to lead as Executive Chairman. Avril is currently Non-Executive Chairman of Redde Northgate plc. She was previously Chairman of Redde plc.

Subsection Title: Manjit Dale founded TDR Capital in 2002. Prior to that, he served as Managing Partner and Head of DB
Subsubsection Text: Capital Partners Europe and has over 25 years’ experience in private equity, leveraged finance and consulting. Manjit started his career in the Management Consultancy division of Arthur Andersen and moved into private equity in 1989 with 3i, and later with NM Rothschild. Manjit graduated from Cambridge University with a MSc degree in Economics.

We are overseen by the board of directors of Constellation Automotive, which is responsible for setting our direction through the establishment of strategies, key policies, and the approval of financial objectives and targets. Furthermore, the board of directors of Constellation Automotive monitors the implementation of strategies and policies through a structured approach of reporting by senior management and recognizes the importance of managing relationships with various stakeholders.

We believe that there are currently no conflicts of interest between the duties owed to us by the members of our boards of directors and their respective private interests. Certain members of the boards of directors of the Parent and Constellation Automotive are representatives of TDR Capital, which is our indirect majority shareholder. In certain situations, the interests of TDR Capital, as indirect majority shareholder, may differ from the interests of our other shareholders. See “Risk Factors—Risk Related to Ownership—The interests of _our controlling shareholder may differ from the interests of the holders of the Notes.”_

The aggregate compensation paid to key management personnel (which comprise of executive members of the Constellation Automotive board) for the 52-week period ended March 28, 2021 was £14.6 million, comprising short-term employees benefits, post-employment benefits and share based payments made during this period. We have established an incentive program for key employees to help meet our strategic objectives, reward superior performance and encourage achievement of personal objectives.

Selected key employees of our management, including the members of the Executive Board, have been provided an opportunity to make an indirect investment alongside TDR under the existing management equity program (the “Management Incentive Program”). As of the date of this Offering Memorandum, the managers participating in the Management Incentive Plan held less than 2% of the capital stock in the Parent. This investment is held indirectly via a management holding company. See “Principal Shareholders.” -----

The industry information has been accurately reproduced and, as far as we are aware and are able to ascertain from information published by such sources, no facts have been omitted which would render the reproduced information inaccurate or misleading._

(2) Aggregated interests of various investment funds managed by NB Alternatives Advisers LLC and calculated on the basis that certain convertible instruments have been so converted in accordance with their terms. (3) A nominee entity representing the interest of certain members of senior management.

TDR Capital is a leading private equity firm which managed funds of over €10 billion of committed capital as of the end of 2020. It was founded in 2002 by Manjit Dale and Stephen Robertson, who were previously partners at DB Capital Partners. TDR Capital has an experienced team of investment professionals and operating partners and has a low-volume investment strategy based on principles developed by the investment team over the past two decades. TDR Capital seeks to spend significant resources on each investment and to focus on operational excellence through a tested and integrated operating partner model. Intense pre-investment analysis and post-investment involvement mean that TDR Capital is selective, typically making only one to three investments a year. TDR Capital takes an active role in overseeing the operations of its investments, working in partnership with management through board representation and professional support. -----

(“Constellation Holdings”) is an indirect parent company of the Parent and was incorporated as a limited liability company (société à responsabilité limitée) under the laws of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg on June 17, 2019.
